Fully-funded open positions will be advertised here. If you don’t see anything, but are still interested in working with the group as an MSc student, PhD student or postdoc, drop us an email with the following information.

If you are an MSc student looking for a thesis/TDK topic

  • Make sure that your university/department agrees doing your thesis with us.
  • Write an email with a short description of who you are, what would you like to do, and why us.

If you are looking for a PhD program

  • Make sure that you are eligible/willing to apply for the Semmelweis PhD School fellowships or external funding. Although the number of fully funded fellowships at the university are limited, external funding might be available through Stipendium Hungaricum (see below) or other means.
  • Write an email with your CV, a one paragraph summary of your most significant scientific contribution, and another paragraph on what you would like to do with us. The topic should be broadly connected to what we already do. The “scientific contribution” might be anything ranging from a conference poster to an interesting dataset, or an R package, not only publications. However, it must be available online, for example at GitHub, figshare, zenodo, protocols.io, etc.

If you are looking for a postdoc position

  • Make sure that you are eligible/willing to apply for external funding.
  • Write an email with your CV, list of publications, a one paragraph summary of your most significant scientific contribution and another paragraph on what you would like to do with us. As long as the idea is interesting and even remotely connected to cancer and molecular biology, we can discuss. Also, as above, “scientific contribution” might mean different things.

External funding opportunities

These are some of the funding opportunities for PhD students and postdocs. Although the chances might be low for some of them, as we are a new group, you can always give it a try and we would be happy to help. There might be other options worth considering.

Hungarian fellowships and opportunities

  • Semmelweis University Directorate of Innovation
  • Stipendium Hungaricum PhD fellowship
  • MTA Prémium Postdoc fellowship
  • Posztdoktori Kiválósági Program
  • Bolyai János Kutatási Ösztöndíj

International fellowships and opportunities

  • Boehringer Ingelheim PhD fellowship
  • Marie-Skodlowska Curie IF postdoc fellowship
  • HFSP Long Term or Cross-Disciplinary postdoc fellowship
  • EMBO Long Term postdoc fellowship
  • FEBS Long Term postdoc fellowship

Detailed lists from others

The following lists are colected by JHU administration and focusing on US, but might contain information useful for hungarian/EU researchers.

  • Graduate Student Funding Opportunities
  • Postdoctoral Funding Opportunities
  • Early Career Funding Opportunities
